noun.description: A state of disorganization or untidiness.
examples: her gray hair was in disarray
his plans have been thrown into disarray

verb.description: Throw (someone or something) into a state of disorganization or untidiness.
examples: the inspection disarrayed the usual schedule
synonyms: throw into a state of disorganization

examples: attendant damsels to help to disarray her

origin: Late Middle English: from Anglo-Norman French dissairay.
